intro: Acrocephalus axillaris, commonly known as the narrowleaf tanglefoot, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tufted, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, pale green to yellowish spikelets that are often clustered at the base of the stems. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Acrocephalus axillaris is typically a short-lived perennial, with its flowering period occurring during the warmer months.
